name: SSCTV2
tagline: Steam Server Creation Tool V2 - Your All-in-One SteamCMD GUI
body:
### Welcome to SSCTV2
Steam Server Creation Tool V2 (SSCTV2) is an advanced, user-friendly GUI utility designed to streamline the process of downloading, installing, and managing multiplayer game servers via SteamCMD. Built to simplify server setup for games on the Steam platform, SSCTV2 eliminates the need for complex console commands, offering an intuitive interface for both beginners and experienced users.

#### Getting Started
To get SSCTV2 up and running:

```
1. Download the latest release from GitHub: https://github.com/n0tic/Steam-Server-Creation-Tool-V2/releases
2. Extract the files to your desired directory.
3. Run `Steam Server Creation Tool V2.exe` and follow the on-screen prompts.
```

Optional: Enable the AutoUpdater by placing `AutoUpdater.exe` in the same folder and checking 'Allow AutoUpdater' in settings.

### Key Features
- **Dynamic Server List**: SSCTV2 fetches an up-to-date list of available servers directly from Steam’s API, ensuring compatibility even as Steam adds or removes servers.
- **Easy Installation**: Select your game, set your install path, and let SSCTV2 handle the rest—no manual SteamCMD scripting required.
- **AutoUpdater**: Keep your tool current with automatic updates (optional feature).
- **Customization**: Configure server settings post-installation with ease.

Supported games include a wide range of Steam titles with dedicated servers—check the app’s live database for the latest options.

### Manual Setup
For advanced users, SSCTV2 still supports direct SteamCMD interaction. Simply configure your settings manually after installation or tweak the generated scripts. Note: Passwords in scripts are stored in clear text if you use the login feature—use with caution!

### Authors and Contributors
Created by n0tic (@n0tic). Contributions welcome—fork the repo and submit a pull request! Special thanks to the open-source community for feedback and testing.

### Support or Contact
Having issues? Check the GitHub Issues page at https://github.com/n0tic/Steam-Server-Creation-Tool-V2/issues or join the community discussion. For direct support, reach out via GitHub.
